Male (Northern).description: Golden-fronted Woodpeckers have a yellow-orange nape unlike Gila Woodpeckers, which have a clean tan nape. In flight, Golden-fronted have white rumps while Gila Woodpeckers have a barred rump. Note range differences.

Male.description: Gilded Flickers have a spotted belly and black chest unlike the clean tan breast seen on Gila Woodpeckers. In flight, Gilded Flickers have yellow underwings that Gila Woodpeckers lack.

Female.description: Female Gilded Flickers have a browner cap than Gila Woodpeckers and spotting on the breast. In flight, Gilded Flickers have yellow underwings that Gila Woodpeckers lack.

Male (Red-shafted).description: Northern Flickers have a spotted belly and black chest unlike the clean tan breast seen on Gila Woodpeckers.
